wrapper function for LHC calibration

Source: R/helper_calibration.R
LHC_model.Rd

A wrapper function for the latin hypercube calibration, used in cali_ensemble when cmethod == "LHC".

Usage

LHC_model(
  pars,
  type,
  model,
  var,
  config_file,
  met,
  folder,
  out_f,
  outf_n,
  obs_deps,
  obs_out,
  out_hour,
  qualfun,
  config_f,
  nout_fun
)

Arguments

pars

data.frame with all parameter sets for the latinhypercube sampling, each row is a set of parameters for which the model is to be run. colnames must be the parameter names

type

character vector specifying the type of parameter. can be either `"met"` for meteo scaling or "model" for model specific parameters, must have one value per column of `pars`

model

the model name for which to run the function

var

variable for which to calculate the model performance (usually this is `"temp"`)

config_file

path to the master config file

met

data.frame with the model specific meteo data, which is then feed to scale_meteo

folder

root folder

out_f

folder in the root folder where the output of the LHC should be written to

outf_n

name of the output file in which the model performance for every parameter set is written

obs_deps

depths of observations

obs_out

data.frame with the observations of `var`

out_hour

FLake specific: hout of output

qualfun

function that takes data.frames of observations and simulations and returns model performance metrics

nout_fun

number of values returned by `qualfun`.

On this page

Developed by Tadhg Moore, Robert Ladwig, Johannes Feldbauer, Jorrit Mesman.
